title: Smaller binutils
body:
I'm trying to keep docker images and buildcaches small, and I found that one of the biggest build dependencies (that I actually need) is binutils:

```
$ du -sh binutils-2.34-4hl4mkoryxkvsy6ejglack3x7ygxl7m5/
755M	binutils-2.34-4hl4mkoryxkvsy6ejglack3x7ygxl7m5/
```

There's many exact duplicates of executables:

```
$ cd binutils-2.34-4hl4mkoryxkvsy6ejglack3x7ygxl7m5
$ du -sh x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/bin/
190M	x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/bin/
$ ls x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/bin/
ar  as	dlltool  ld  ld.bfd  ld.gold  nm  objcopy  objdump  ranlib  readelf  strip
$ ls bin/
addr2line  ar  as  c++filt  coffdump  dlltool  dllwrap	dwp  elfedit  gprof  ld  ld.bfd  ld.gold  nm  objcopy  objdump	ranlib	readelf  size  srconv  strings	strip  sysdump	windmc	windres
$ du -sh bin/
262M	bin/
$ for f in x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/bin/*; do diff "bin/$(basename $f)" "$f"; done
$
```

Some binaries are for more than 95% debuginfo:

```
$ cd bin
$ du -sh ld.gold 
131M	ld.gold
$ ./strip --strip-all ld.gold 
$ du -sh ld.gold 
5.2M	ld.gold
```

### Description

Before https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/9388 is a thing, should we just add a patch to drop the `-g` flag from binutils by default? I think #9388 is a bit difficult for the binutils package itself, since binutils provides the `strip` executable...

Further I can check why there's duplicate binaries being installed instead of just symlinks (or maybe we can just drop that x86_64-pc-linux-gnu folder).

### General information

```
$ spack --version
0.15.4-567-632032c02
```
